intro: Stigmaphyllon lineare var. morroensis, commonly known as the Morroense stigmaphyllon, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its linear, lance-shaped leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
